intro: Vallesia hypoglauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, soft, blue-gray foliage that resembles a misty cloud, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Vallesia hypoglauca thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and ability to attract pollinators.
